intro: Picris kaimaensis, commonly known as the Kaimana goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the island of Kaimana in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy environments, showcasing adaptations to saline and well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green ray florets, and it produces small, cylindrical achenes as its seeds. Picris kaimaensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
